Uses of Interface
parallel.TaskObject

  • Packages that use TaskObject 
    Package Description
    parallel
    parallel package: an implementation of all the synchronization, communication & coordination primitives required in popt4jlib.
    parallel.distributed
    Extends the basic functionality found in the parallel package over many remote JVMs distributed over a network of machines.
    popt4jlib
    popt4jlib: a parallel optimization library for Java.
    popt4jlib.NumberPartitioning
    Package defines parallel/distributed versions of well-known Number Partitioning algorithms.
    popt4jlib.PS
    Particle Swarm Optimization Algorithms Parallel Implementation.

    • Uses of TaskObject in parallel

      Subinterfaces of TaskObject in parallel 
      Modifier and Type Interface and Description
      interface  ComparableTaskObject
      empty interface for use with dynamic, priority-based task msg-passing coordinators and executors.
      Methods in parallel with parameters of type TaskObject 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void TaskObject.copyFrom(TaskObject other)
      support the ability to copy the state of other into this TaskObject.
      boolean LimitedTimeTaskExecutor.execute(TaskObject task)
      executes the TaskObject argument in a different thread, and waits for _msecs2wait milliseconds for the run() method of the task object to finish.
      void OrderedBarrier.orderedBarrier(TaskObject task)
      the main method to call when a barrier point must be erected.

    • Uses of TaskObject in parallel.distributed

      Methods in parallel.distributed with parameters of type TaskObject 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      java.lang.Object[] PDBatchTaskExecutorClt.submitWork(java.lang.String originating_client, TaskObject[] tasks)
      the main method of the class.
      java.lang.Object[] PDBatchTaskExecutorClt.submitWork(java.util.Vector originating_clients, TaskObject[] tasks)
      same method as submitWork(client, tasks) but carries all the names of the hosts that have submitted the tasks to various servers (only applies when there exists more than one server in the system of servers, clients and workers).
      java.lang.Object[] PDBatchTaskExecutorClt.submitWorkFromSameHost(TaskObject[] tasks)
      the main method of the class.

    • Uses of TaskObject in popt4jlib

      Classes in popt4jlib that implement TaskObject 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      class  FunctionEvaluationTask
      auxiliary class used when the user requests function evaluations to be executed in separate threads in a thread-pool for a limited time so as to avoid "locking-up" the minimization process by function evaluations that take too long to complete (such evaluations are "lost" by the minimization process even if they eventually complete).
      Methods in popt4jlib with parameters of type TaskObject 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void FunctionEvaluationTask.copyFrom(TaskObject t)
      copy state from the input argument.

    • Uses of TaskObject in popt4jlib.NumberPartitioning

      Classes in popt4jlib.NumberPartitioning that implement TaskObject 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      class  NPTask
      class implements the CKK algorithm (Complete Karmarkar-Karp Algorithm) for 2-way Number Partitioning, due to R.
      Methods in popt4jlib.NumberPartitioning with parameters of type TaskObject 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void NPTask.copyFrom(TaskObject other)
      throws exception (unsupported).

    • Uses of TaskObject in popt4jlib.PS

      Classes in popt4jlib.PS that implement TaskObject 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      class  RecvIndTask
      used in migrating individuals between islands in DPSO (or other ps-based approaches, eg FA).
      Methods in popt4jlib.PS with parameters of type TaskObject 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void RecvIndTask.copyFrom(TaskObject t)
      performs a shallow copy of the immigrants, pool, and "done" status of the object passed in to this object.
